definition: changing suddenly in direction and degree, marked by practical hardheaded intelligence, a long thin sewing needle with a sharp point
details:
adverb
- changing suddenly in direction and degree
= example: changing suddenly in direction and degree
= synonyms: sharply
adjective
- marked by practical hardheaded intelligence
= synonyms: astute, shrewd
- (of something seen or heard) clearly defined
= example: (of something seen or heard) clearly defined
= synonyms: crisp
- having or made by a thin edge or sharp point
- keenly and painfully felt
= example: keenly and painfully felt
- quick and forceful
= example: quick and forceful
- very sudden and in great amount or degree
= example: very sudden and in great amount or degree
- extremely steep
= synonyms: abrupt, precipitous, perpendicular
- having or emitting a high-pitched and sharp tone or tones
= synonyms: shrill
- (of a musical note) raised in pitch by one chromatic semitone
- having or demonstrating ability to recognize or draw fine distinctions
= synonyms: acute, discriminating, knifelike, incisive, keen, penetrative, penetrating, piercing
- harsh
= example: harsh
= synonyms: unrelenting, brutal, sharp-worded, tart
- ending in a sharp point
= synonyms: acute, acuate, needlelike
noun
- a long thin sewing needle with a sharp point
- a musical notation indicating one half step higher than the note named
